entry.title: 'If They Recognize Me, They Will Me.' The Grinding Terror of an Afghan Interpreter Who Helped the U.S.
entry.content: Ahmad Jawed wonders which will come first—approval for a U.S. visa or capture by Taliban forces hunting people like him.

entry.title: Germany Is Losing Its Mojo. Finding It Again Won't Be Easy.
entry.content: Europe’s biggest economy is sliding into stagnation, and its fractured political class is struggling to find answers to long-term headaches and short-term crises.

entry.title: Manufacturers Leaving China Find a Home With Indian Startups
entry.content: India is looking to build up its factory base, and venture-capital investors are noticing.
